title: Drawing, "Stage Curtain Design: Parnassus with Apollo and the Muses", ca. 1812
medium: Pen and brown ink brown, brush with wateroclor wash over black chalk and traces of graphite on laid paper.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle: Arcadian landscape. Foreground, personification of river source and person with wings writing. In the middle, Apollo and muses; in the back, temple. In foreground stage framing, lyre and altar. Squared for copying.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Stage Curtain Design: Parnassus with Apollo and the Muses", ca. 1812.
ca. 1812. Pen and brown ink brown, brush with wateroclor wash over black chalk and traces of graphite on laid paper.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-91.
